messages: d3c43cdfd618935d601322f674335a46 (08:05): maybe a silly question, why is there a "return false;" at the end of most onclick functions handlers that i see?
d3c43cdfd618935d601322f674335a46 (08:07): nevermind, got it
d3c43cdfd618935d601322f674335a46 (08:16): i have an array of objects, whats the cleanest way to get the last element in the array?  i have the prototype library available
d3c43cdfd618935d601322f674335a46 (08:17): i guess, is there any way cleaner than Element.remove(sections[sections.length-1].id);
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (08:17): pop, if it has Array's prototype.
301e3b9c1d5cb19ce1e09c950720fcfb (08:37): Is it possible to fire an event when the height of an element changes?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:39): `js watch
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:40): meekish:  I'm assuming this is for when resizing the window?

301e3b9c1d5cb19ce1e09c950720fcfb (08:40): no, actually i will be using it to detect when the size of a page loaded into an iframe changes. I am trying to simulate a liquid iframe; one that grows with its contents rather than displaying a scrollbar
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:43): meekish:  check the iframe's scrollHeight
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:43): I think is scrollHeight or offsetHeight

301e3b9c1d5cb19ce1e09c950720fcfb (08:47): hmmm... scrollHeight just seems to be returning the actual height of the iframe. How would I find out what the height is of the page that is loaded into the iframe?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:54): meekish:  document.defaultView.getComputedStyle(YOURNODEHERE, '').getPropertyValue("height");  for geckos, as for IE YOURNODEHERE.runtimeStyle.height
301e3b9c1d5cb19ce1e09c950720fcfb (08:55): great. ty
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (08:57): and no solution for IE
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (08:57): sorry, reflex
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (08:57): no solution for Opera
1a01d17f4814075aa5d112b6c2d86419 (08:57): how would I hide and reveal a field box?
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (08:58): I should make a tutorial on that and add it to the bot
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (08:58): We used to have that one wiki
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (08:58): step 1> .hidden { display: none; } step 2> add/remove that class to said element using JS
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (08:59): `js class # can help
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (08:59): js class: http://phrogz.net/JS/AddClassKillClass_js.txt
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (09:02): remember that hidingit on the UI does not prevent it from getting submitted

1a01d17f4814075aa5d112b6c2d86419 (09:04): oh okay. Is there a way around that? Cause i am trying to use a dropdown menu so when one item is selected i get another drop down, and then when I select something else on that list I would get a file upload form instead.

f23ee1a0fd286a448de53a07931e83ee (09:05): I am looking to use select boxes to sort. I want to have a bunch of items, with a select next to each. In the select I want numbers. 1 to N. When I change the value of one, I want it to adjust the rest. So if I make the one ranked 3rd, 1st. It should move the 1st to 2nd, and 2nd to 3rd. Anyone know of a good tutorial or existing script to do that. I ccan't come up with the best search terms to find one
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:24): well
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:24): you could peruse around at http://www.javascriptkit.com/cutpastejava.shtml
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (09:25): for any premade one, but I'd think the repainting of the data will be there no matter what method
